ygData.subject: RE: A rant
ygData.msgSnippet: And then there are those with he hours to be much higher than we are, but can t seem to figure out how to make those hours turn into levels :( My enchanter has
ygData.messageBody:
And then there are those with he hours to be much higher than we
are, but can't seem to figure out how to make those hours turn into
levels :(

My enchanter has been level 13 since November. And, in that time,
I've put 40 hours onto her. (at least. I did not get a /played
right when I hit 13) She is still over a bubble from 14. If hell
levels are worse than this, I don't want to see them.

...What I'm REALLY looking forward to though is hitting level 20. I
want to get a last name at least once...

Sarah Heacock sarah@...
Meara, level 13 Enchanter, Master Jeweler, owner Meara's Boutique of
Mystiques, Phoenix, Solusek Ro /
Faerain, level 18 Soldier of Tunare, Phoenix, Solusek Ro /
Faesong, level 7 HalfElf Bard of Solusek Ro, Phoenix, Solusek Ro
(Blackburrow -- when I get back from Kelethin)
>-----Original Message-----
>From: "Paul D Richardson" [mailto:Richardson.Paul@...]
>Sent: Tuesday, February 08, 2000 1:05 PM
>To: eqbards@onelist.com
>Subject: Re: [eqbards] A rant
>
>
>From: ("Paul D Richardson") <Richardson.Paul@...>
>
>> Here is the part I think he is referring to. I would interpret
>it somewhat
>> differently. I dont read "never" in here - just that it will take a lot
>> longer in real time.
>
>Which is, of course, how it should be. As a casual gamer playing 2 hours a
>night, I should expect to advance slower than somebody who plays 12 hours a
>day. There's no "bias" against casual gamers in EQ that doesn't
>exist in any
>other online game. And it's not really accurate to call it a bias
>either...after all would it be fair for me to level 6x faster than Joe
>Collegestudent just because I can't play as much as him?
>
